trans-unit.source: Review the animated part of the learning objective
View the test that your child is currently struggling with

Animated exercises are vital - they introduce new maths concepts, test initial understanding of those concepts, and provide specific help where necessary.

You can use this practice tool to help give your child the confidence to re-attempt, and pass, this exercise in Tutor Mode. In this practice tool your child can get to grips with the key ideas, and answer the questions that follow. It helps to pay particular attention to the initial teaching section - where present - and use the skills and information it describes in the questions that follow.

The pass mark for an exercise is 70%.

Your child may need assistance understanding written questions, or interpreting the question. It can help to have your child tell you what they think the exercise requires of them. Encourage them to answer each question with care.

Work completed in this practice tool will not affect your child's Tutor Mode results. They will need to pass this exercise in Tutor Mode to progress.
Please continue with the next exercise just clicking on the arrow button.

This test is very important.

It consolidates concepts that your child learned in the respective animated exercise, and prepares them for what they might see in a formal test environment. Tests donӴ feature rich animations or sound effects, student's can just focus on the maths.

The pass mark for a test is 60%.

You can use this practice tool to help your child understand what the test requires them to do. You can read the questions out loud, or explain the context of the questions, but ensure they answer the questions on their own.

Work completed in this practice tool will not affect Tutor Mode results. Your child will need to pass this test in Tutor Mode to progress.

This test is very important.

The pass mark for a test is 60%.

Work completed in this practice tool will not affect Tutor Mode results. Your child will need to pass this test in Tutor Mode to progress.
Please continue with the next exercise just clicking on the arrow button.
